attributes.additional_details: Self-esteem issues and eating disorders continue to be a huge problem  for young people in the UK. The apps and methods advertised on TikTok promote methods of weight loss that, without the consultation of a doctor, could be incredibly dangerous. TikTok is a growing platform which is a fantastic space for young people to express their creativity however it is the Government's duty to ensure that they are safe on this platform.
attributes.background: The government should ban social media platform TikTok (which is used by many children between the ages of 13-18) from profiting from sponsored adverts by apps that promote weight loss and fasting.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for advertisers and TikTok as private businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you wish to complain about an advertisement you see on a social media platform such as TikTok you may be able to complain to the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA). You can find out what they cover here: https://www.asa.org.uk/about-asa-and-cap/the-work-we-do/what-we-cover.html.

You can complain to the Equality and Human Rights Commission, if you see an advert on social media which you feel discriminates against someone on the grounds of sex: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/complaint-policy-and-procedure.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for action to tackle body shaming in the media: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331926.
